metadata.title: CVE-2021-47077 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:qedf: Add pointer checks in qedf_update_link_speed() The following tracewas observed: [ 14.042059] Call Trace: [ 14.042061] <IRQ> [ 14.042068]qedf_link_update+0x144/0x1f0 [qedf] [ 14.042117] qed_link_update+0x5c/0x80[qed] [ 14.042135] qed_mcp_handle_link_change+0x2d2/0x410 [qed] [14.042155] ? qed_set_ptt+0x70/0x80 [qed] [ 14.042170] ?qed_set_ptt+0x70/0x80 [qed] [ 14.042186] ? qed_rd+0x13/0x40 [qed] [14.042205] qed_mcp_handle_events+0x437/0x690 [qed] [ 14.042221] ?qed_set_ptt+0x70/0x80 [qed] [ 14.042239] qed_int_sp_dpc+0x3a6/0x3e0 [qed] [14.042245] tasklet_action_common.isra.14+0x5a/0x100 [ 14.042250]__do_softirq+0xe4/0x2f8 [ 14.042253] irq_exit+0xf7/0x100 [ 14.042255]do_IRQ+0x7f/0xd0 [ 14.042257] common_interrupt+0xf/0xf [ 14.042259] </IRQ>API qedf_link_update() is getting called from QED but by that timeshost_data is not initialised. This results in a NULL pointer dereferencewhen we try to dereference shost_data while updating supported_speeds. Adda NULL pointer check before dereferencing shost_data.
